text.0: water and milk hath he endued sent forth to thee the men have drained him with the filters and the stones.
text.1: drink indra from the hotars bowlfirst right is thinesoma hallowed and poured with vaṣaṭ and svāhā.
text.2: busied with sacrifice with spotted deer and spears gleaming upon your way with ornaments yea our friends.
text.3: sitting on sacred grass ye sons of bhārata drink soma from the potars bowl o men of heaven.
text.4: come unto us ye swift to listen as at home upon the sacred grass sit and enjoy yourselves.
text.5: and tvaṣṭar wellcontent be joyful in the juice with gods and goddesses in gladsome company.
text.6: bring the gods hither sage and offer sacrifice at the three altars seat thee willingly o priest.
text.7: accept for thy delight the proffered soma meath drink from the kindlers bowl and fill thee with thy share.
text.8: this is the strengthener of thy bodys manly might strength victory for all time are placed within thine arms.
text.9: pressed for thee maghavan it is offered unto thee drink from the chalice of this brahman drink thy fill.
text.10: accept the sacrifice mark both of you my call the priest hath seated him after the ancient texts.
text.11: my prayer that bids them come goes forth to both the kings drink ye the soma meath from the directors bowl.
